newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai rice closes unchanged in slow trading.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai rice closes unchanged in slow trading.

text.p: Shanghai rice futures ended unchanged in slow trading on Tuesday, with most investors staying on the sidelines, traders said.
The only traded September 1996 contract ended at 2,536 yuan ($305) per tonne, unchanged from Monday's close. It opened at 2,534 yuan, hitting an intra-day low of 2,520 and high of 2,540.
Traders said rice continued to meet strong technical resistance at high levels due to a lack of follow-up buying.
"It is risky to build long positions at these levels due to poor fundamentals," one trader said.
Traders said rice was likely to complete the technical rebound of the past few days unless there was support from institutions. ($1=8.3065 yuan)
